wikipedia_page.main: Hilda Bor (7 May 1910 – 19 December 1993) was a British classical pianist of Russian-Jewish descent.

response: The City Music Society was formed in London, United Kingdom, in 1943. It was influenced by lunchtime concerts organised by Hilda Bor at the Royal Exchange and by Myra Hess at the National Gallery. The driving force in the Society's foundation was Ivan Sutton, with help and encouragement by Bor, who became its Vice-President, and from Edric Cundell, Principal of the Guildhall School of Music, who served as its first President. It was described in an obituary of Sutton as "one of the City of London's most remarkable institutions".Obituary: Ivan Sutton The Independent, June 28, 1996
